links.title: Tesla garners momentum - Analysis - 22-02-2018
links.description: Tesla's stock (TSLA) fell in the intraday levels, registering a loss of 0.44% in the last session, or 1.47 points, as the stock tries to gather momentum to help it rise anew, with positive signals from the RSI, coupled with the dominance of the upward trend in the medium and short terms, and with positive pressure from the 50-day SMA.

links.title: PAZ Mission
links.description: SpaceX is targeting a Falcon 9 launch of the PAZ satellite to low-Earth orbit on Wednesday, February 21 from Space Launch Complex 4 East (SLC-4E) at Vandenberg Air Force Base, California. The instantaneous launch opportunity is at 6:17 a.m. PST, or 14:17 UTC. The satellite will be deployed approximately eleven minutes after launch.

messages.body: $TSLA Consumers ordering either of the models can expect wait times of four to five months for delivery. https://stocknews.com/news/tsla-tesla-inc-tsla-extends-delays-for-model-s-and-model/

links.title: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Extends Delays For Model S And Model X, Citing High Demand
links.description: Demand has been high for Tesla Inc's (NASDAQ:TSLA) Model S and Model X types, and that's creating a backlog. That's the word from the automaker, which has extended the delays for both models. Electrek has additional details on the wrench that has been thrown in the company's plans.

messages.body: $TSLA Erratic swings are the new norm, until recession. I still say Tesla is solid in recession.  https://www.truthdig.com/articles/groundhog-day-fed/

links.title: Groundhog Day for the Fed
links.description: Groundhog Day is Feb. 2. As tradition has it, Punxsutawney Phil pops up from his burrow, wiggles his nose, searches for his shadow and then, if he sees it, casts his prediction for six more weeks of winter (he did see it this year, by the way).

source.name: Truthdig: Expert Reporting, Current News, Provocative Columnists

links.title: A Cold Analysis On 2017 And A Look Beyond
links.description: The finest trick of the devil is to persuade you that he does not exist Charles Baudelaire I've my own version of this: 'the finest trick of the devil is to persuade you that social sciences exist.' Although my background is economics, during my years in the market, I've loosen up the idea that Economics is a proper science.
